org.jsapar.schema
Class Schema

java.lang.Object
  org.jsapar.schema.Schema
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable, ParseSchema
Direct Known Subclasses:
CsvSchema, FixedWidthSchema
public abstract class Schema
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable, ParseSchema

Abstract base class for all type of jsapar schemas. A schema describes how the buffer should be parsed or how the lines of a Document should be written. Usually the parse and output methods are called from one of the in, out or io classes.

Author:
Jonas
See Also:
Xml2SchemaBuilder, Schema2XmlExtractor

outputLine

public boolean outputLine(Line line,
                          java.io.Writer writer)
                   throws java.io.IOException,
                          JSaParException
This method should only be called by a Outputter class. Don't use this directly in your code. Use a Outputter instead. This method writes a line according to the schema line, with the same line type, which is found in this schema.

Parameters:
line -
lineNumber -
writer -
Returns:
false if no matching schema line was found. true otherwise.
